title: The A.I. Spending Frenzy Is Propping Up the Real Economy, Too
summary: The trillions of dollars that tech companies are pouring into new data centers are starting to show up in economic growth. For now, at least.

title: Trump Raises Tariffs on India to 50% Over Russian Oil
summary: As punishment for buying Russian oil, President Trump is doubling the tax on goods imported from India, jeopardizing a relationship decades in the making.

title: How A.I. Is Propping Up the Economy, and a Surge of ‘Swatting’ on Campus
summary: Plus, why men aren’t going to the doctor.

title: Trump Again Escalates Power Grabs in Bid to Fire Fed Member
summary: President Trump claimed he has cause to remove a member of the independent board who has not obeyed his demands to vote for lower interest rates.

title: Trump Plays Reality Television Host at Cabinet Meeting That Lasts Hours
summary: As hours ticked by, President Trump played reality television host — “This has never been done before!” — as his cabinet members offered praise. It was a glimpse of how he runs his presidency.

title: FEMA Suspends Staff Who Signed a Letter Criticizing Trump
summary: The letter, sent to Congress on Monday, said cuts made by the Trump administration had erased improvements made to disaster response since Hurricane Katrina.

title: Federal Money Is a ‘Lifeline’ for This Republican School District
summary: President Trump wants to cut federal spending for education. The money often goes toward disadvantaged students in Republican states.

title: Purging ‘Equity’ Programs, G.O.P. Defunded Its Own Roads
summary: When Republicans repealed a Biden-era “access and equity” grant program for transportation, they canceled funding for projects in some of their own districts.

title: Targeted by the Emirates, an Arab Dissident Vanished Across Borders
summary: After criticizing the United Arab Emirates on social media, an Egyptian activist was extradited to the Gulf country, where he has been detained without trial for months.

title: Van Gogh Museum in Fight With Dutch State That Threatens Its Future
summary: Its director says that the Amsterdam museum could close unless the culture ministry increases funding to pay for a refurbishment.

title: With Fuzzy Racket Bag, Venus Williams Highlights ERL and Other American Labels
summary: In her return at the U.S. Open, Ms. Williams decided to highlight labels based in the United States. Her shearling racket bag was hard to miss.

title: In a Lab, a Hunt for a Killer: The Germ Causing a Legionnaires’ Outbreak
summary: Six people in New York City have died this summer from Legionnaires’ disease, and more than 100 others have been sickened.

title: They’re (Mostly) Good Dogs and Even Better Film Symbols
summary: Directors use our canine friends to convey connection even as we’ve grown more disconnected from the animal world.

title: Taylor Swift’s Engagement Ring Marks a Return to Vintage Elegance
summary: The pop star’s antique-inspired sparkler channels the “heirloom look,” reflecting a return to antique stones.

title: This Couple Predicted Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s Relationship 5 Years Ago
summary: They needed a Halloween costume. Five years later, some have suggested that they manifested the “Tayvis” marriage.

title: The Rise of the Democratic National Security Mom
summary: The party is counting on a new type of leader to counteract Trump.

title: This Is Why New Orleans Never Recovered From Katrina
summary: New Orleans after Katrina is a cautionary tale for every place in America that will one day face its own disaster.

title: The New State Interventions
summary: Protectionism, industrial policy and government ownership — all once conservative boogeymen — have become official doctrine.

title: Denmark Summons U.S. Envoy Over Espionage Allegations
summary: It’s the latest twist in the Greenland drama. President Trump wants the island, but Denmark refuses to hand it over.

title: Floods and Landslides Kill Dozens on Pilgrimage Route in Kashmir
summary: Rescue workers pulled bodies from the debris after rain sent boulders and mud crashing down.

title: UK Summers, and Houses, Are Getting Hotter
summary: Built for a cooler climate, many homes need to be retrofitted for warming temperatures. It won’t be as simple as installing air-conditioning.

title: Cracker Barrel Drops New Logo Design After Conservative Backlash
summary: The chain, known for its farmhouse aesthetic, ignited a social media firestorm when it announced its “fresh” rebrand last week.
